name: Mercure Avignon Cite des Papes

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Let me start by saying if you are driving to this hotel it will be a challenge! And when you think you've finally made it, you then need to find the parking lot and park your car! One way system with small narrow roads, but that makes it fun!
reviews.title: Not a four star but great location - adequate

reviews.text: Location is right next to Palais de Papes, a must see even if you're not into history!
reviews.title: Perfect location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food in Avignon is probably best off the beaten track as we had some ordinary meals!
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, Convenient Location

reviews.text: The room is fairly small, air conditioning average, adequate but probably would place this hotel as a 3 star. We knew this when reading TA before we booked but still liked the sound of the location, so if location is what you want (and you don't want to spend time in your room) then the hotel is probably perfect.
reviews.title: Great Location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Either way, soak up the atmosphere of Avignon and you manage to find this crazy Tapas bar playing live music like we did, enjoy!
reviews.title: Very conventient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel located on the corner of Le Place d'Horloge & Place des Palais about 20 yards from the Palace entrance. central & easy walking distance to all sights and museums
reviews.title: First Class Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel has recently been refurbished and redecorated to a high standard. Check in extremely quick with minimum of formalites. Room was a good size, well decorated and spotlessly clean. Minibar, safe and flat screen TV together with tea & coffee facilities and plenty of power points.Duvaits on bed plus additional blankets & pillows in wardrobe.
reviews.title: In the presence of the palace

reviews.text: Bathroom spacious with very smart bath and shower, plenty of towels and toiletries. Even had a shaving mirrror, again spotlessly clean. Breakfast room/restaurant a little cramped, although additional seating was available under the awning. Good selection of cereals, bread & croisants, cold meats,yoghurts etc plus hot food. Tea & coffee from a machine.
reviews.title: Definitely would stay again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a very well located hotel especially since we were allocated the 6th floor room that has a terrace that opens out onto the Papal Palace. The room was modern and well-equipped and while we could have done with more tea bags, the breakfasts were fine. The service from the staff was very helpful - they found us a doctor and also reserved the next room in a Mercure hotel in Nice. We would not have asked them to do this had not this hotel and the desk staff of this Mercure more than met our expectations.
reviews.title: Wonderful

reviews.text: This hotel was perfectly located for all activities. The rooms were very comfortable & modern. We were a couple of grandparents with a 12 year old grandson & the sofa opened into a very large bed for him. The tea/coffee service needed monitoring since the staff did not always leave the correct amount of supplies. The breakfast room was adequate but the dinner we had there was the best we ate in Avignon. The staff were very friendly & helpful. There were some renovations taking place while we were there but we were not bothered by them.
reviews.title: Best choice of hotel in Avignon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel's web site didn't make clear that one has to enter the underground parking at the other Mercure to reach (more or less) this Mercure. Sadly, the review that describes this was written after our stay in early June.
reviews.title: A nice hotel, but hard to reach by car

reviews.text: Eventually, we stopped at the other Mercure to inquire and were told to go into the underground parking and get out at the far end. We had heavy bags and the parking attendant refused to let us use the wheelchair elevator, so my husband carried the rolling bags up a steep flight of steps and we had to drag them several blocks to the hotel. We were hot and furious! At the hotel, they showed us a closer entrance/exit, but it also involved stairs.
reviews.title: Great location , but ----

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we checked out, we inquired about the possibility of driving the car directly to the hotel and were given directions to do so. We retrieved the car from the underground parking, went out of the area, around, and back in and worked our way to the hotel. These directions should be given to prospective guests.
reviews.title: Location great, everything else, poor
No air-con and No apologies
reviews.text: As for the hotel itself, our room was fine -- not memorable one way or the other. The A/C worked well.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a very good dinner one night outside at the hotel's restaurant
reviews.title: Nice hotel really close to the Pope's Palace

reviews.text: I go to Avignon on a regular basis and decided this week to try the Mercure cite des Papes. It was such a disappointment that I have been compelled to register to TripAdvisor to write a review.
reviews.title: No aircon: only go if you want to bake

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I asked for a room in a quiet part of the hotel as I have a very light sleep. I was given a room on the second floor, in the middle of the corridor, straight above the street and I had the joy to hear garbage lorries several times in the night, one at 11:30pm and the second time at 5:30am. I will go into the details of describing the pleasure to hear kids running in the corridor until past midnight - In fact I could forgive this, despite the fact that I asked a quiet room.
reviews.title: Location and price

reviews.text: What I cannot forgive is the fact that I came in the room to the sound of a really noisy air conditioning system, blowing hot air in the tiniest room I have ever seen. the air conditioning was set up to cold and clearly something was wrong there. When I asked reception, I was told that there were some issues with the air conditioning system in the whole hotel, which was surprising as the reception downstairs was really nice and fresh. My colleague also confirmed that his room, tiny too, was fine in terms of the temperature. The gentlemen at reception didn't seem really bothered though and couldn't offer another bedroom, but gave me some great advice: basically keep the window shut (it was more than 30 degrees outside) and keep the curtains closed, as the room is south facing. As you can expect I had a terrible night and I felt like I was been baked in a oven. I didn't sleep at all.
reviews.title: Sadly disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When I checked out In the morning I complained and was told that the management was looking into getting the air con fixed. 'Looking into' doesn't seem to be treated as an emergency, so I am wondering how ethical and professional it is to rent bedrooms without air conditioning in the middle of Provence and in the summer. I was told that there is an issue with some of the bedrooms, so I supposed you take a chance and will not know what the deal will be until you get there.
reviews.title: Perfect hotel unless it is really hot

aka: Mercure Avignon Cite Des Papes Hotel Avignon
description: A privileged location in the heart of the city. The Mercure Cite des Papes is situated on the Place d Horloge square, the vibrant centre of the old city with its theatre and numerous cafes. Close by is the Palais des Papes, or Palace of the Popes, incorporating the International Convention Centre. 89 comfortable rooms. All in all, this hotel is the ideal place to discover the charms of the city and make the most of your visit to Avignon.
